title: Moshi Twilight: can a phone app really help my children fall asleep?
text:
Bath, pyjamas, teeth, story – Poppy and Finn Chambers’ bedtime routine is identical to that of countless other children across Britain. Until, that is, the time comes for lights out, and their father, Ian, flicks open an app on his iPhone and lets them choose their “sleep story”. As Poppy, who is eight, and Finn, four, drift off to the dreamy visualisations of Close Your Eyes Sleepypaws or Mr Snoodle’s Twilight Train, he heads downstairs to chat to his wife. Twenty minutes later, when the story softly tails off, they will be sound asleep, cuddling their teddies.

As the CEO of Mind Candy, the children’s entertainment company responsible for this new piece of parenting tech, Chambers is an obvious...
description: Bath, pyjamas, teeth, story – Poppy and Finn Chambers’ bedtime routine is identical to that of countless other children across Britain.
